alert.note: Alert for Bath; Montgomery (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 5:39PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Montgomery and western Bath Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grassy Lick, or near Mount Sterling, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mount Sterling around 545 PM EDT. Stoops, Judy, Ewington and Gatewoods Station around 550 PM EDT. Sharpsburg, Flat Creek, Stepstone, Howards Mill and Peeled Oak around 555 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kendall Springs, Preston, Crooks, Owingsville, Reynoldsville, Bethel and Bourbon Furnace. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 123. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
